kszucs commented on a change in pull request #10659:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10659#discussion_r664172803



##########
File path: wheel.sh
##########
@@ -0,0 +1,26 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env bash
+
+arrow_dir=$1
+build_dir=$2
+
+export ARROW_FLIGHT=OFF
+export ARROW_JEMALLOC=OFF
+export ARROW_SIMD_LEVEL=NONE
+export BUILD_PREFIX=$build_dir

Review comment:
       If we don't set `BUILD_PREFIX` to a non-existing location then [multibuild will set it to /usr/local](https://github.com/matthew-brett/multibuild/blob/devel/configure_build.sh#L71-L80) causing a pretty misleading cmake issue.
   
   CMake tries to locate numpy's include path [by importing it](https://github.com/Kitware/CMake/blob/v3.19.2/Modules/FindPython/Support.cmake#L3075) swallowing any errors. If `BUILD_PREFIX` is set to `/usr/local` then multibuild will prepend `PATH` by `/usr/local/bin` which is brew's `x86_64` installation prefix. This causes the shell script to call the `x86_64` variant of `cmake` instead of the `arm64` one under `/opt/homebrew/bin` which calls the universal2 python binary as `x86_64` where importing an `arm64` compiled numpy will fail, but silently, making CMake unable to locate numpy for both compiling libarrow_python and pyarrow.

fields.summary: [Python] Cannot install via pip M1 mac

comments.body:
We'll provide wheel for arm64 macOS when we release a new version.
We'll release a new version next month.
Please wait for a while.
Oh great to hear! I'll give it a while next month then :) In the meantime I've installed it via conda and it seems to be ok.

Sorry. I misunderstood.
We've prepared arm64 wheel only for Linux. We didn't work on arm64 wheel for macOS.

We can work on it after we merge ARROW-12139. But we don't have CI environment for arm64 macOS...
[~kou] I see that's a shame. Could I help in any way?
Thanks. Do you have knowledge to build arm64 wheel for macOS on GitHub Actions, Azure Pipelines, Drone Cloud and so on?
https://github.com/matthew-brett/multibuild now support cross-compiling for Apple Silicon, we should be able to reuse the current macOS builds with a different target.
That sounds like a good idea!

I tried it https://github.com/kou/arrow/tree/wheel-macos-arm64 but it doesn't work yet: https://github.com/kou/crossbow/runs/2318804043?check_suite_focus=true

Anyone can continue this. I don't have enough time to work on this for now. (And I don't have enough spec macOS to work on this on local.)
cc [~amol-] . We will need to provide M1 wheels at some point.
I see in the commit message that the wheel is only compiled for python3.9. Am I correct? If yes, can we expect pyarrow to be installable at all on macOS M1 for python3.8?
thank you very much [~kszucs]! will this affect released versions or should we wait for a new release?
